intro: Heuffelia convoluta, commonly known as the twisted heuffelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often form dense mats. The leaves are typically alternate, with a distinctive reddish or purple hue on the underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
